title: How to Wipe a Mac Clean

steps.title: Back up any data you want to save
steps.content: Back up any data you want to save . Wiping your Mac will erase everything, including your operating system, so keeping a backup on an external hard drive or DVD is a good idea. [1] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 February 2021.

steps.title: Open the Apple menu.
steps.content: Open the Apple menu. It's the black apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click on Restart….
steps.content: Click on Restart… . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click Restart to confirm.
steps.content: Click Restart to confirm. This immediately shuts down and reboots your Mac. Wait for your Mac to shut down.

steps.title: Press and hold ⌘+R as the Mac restarts.
steps.content: Press and hold ⌘ + R as the Mac restarts. Alternately, turn the computer off, then hold ⌘ + R as you hit the power button to turn it back on. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 February 2021.

steps.title: Release the keys when you see the Apple logo.
steps.content: Release the keys when you see the Apple logo. The "macOS Utilities" window will appear.

steps.title: Click on Disk Utility.
steps.content: Click on Disk Utility . It's at the bottom of the list.

steps.title: Click on Continue.
steps.content: Click on Continue . It's in the lower-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click on your Mac's hard drive.
steps.content: Click on your Mac's hard drive. It's in the upper-left of the window, under "Internal."

steps.title: Click on Erase.
steps.content: Click on Erase . It's a button at the top-center of the window.

steps.title: Name your disk.
steps.content: Name your disk. Type it in the "Name:" field.

steps.title: Click on the "Format:"
steps.content: Click on the "Format:" drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a format.
steps.content: Select a format. To reinstall a MacOS system, select: Mac OS Extended (Journaled) for the fastest wipe. Mac OS Extended (Journaled, Encrypted) to encrypt the disk after wiping.

steps.title: Click on Erase.
steps.content: Click on Erase . It's in the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The wipe process will begin. The time to erase your disk will vary based on disk size, the amount of data stored, and whether your chose an encrypted format.

steps.title: Back up any data you want to save
steps.content: Back up any data you want to save . Wiping your Mac will erase everything, including your operating system, so keeping a backup on an external hard drive or DVD is a good idea.

steps.title: Insert your installation disc.
steps.content: Insert your installation disc. Insert the installation DVD or CD that came with your computer into the computer's disc drive and wait for the computer to recognize the disc. If you are using a USB drive instead of an installation disc, insert the USB drive.

steps.title: Open the Apple menu.
steps.content: Open the Apple menu. It's the black apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click on Restart….
steps.content: Click on Restart… . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click Restart to confirm.
steps.content: Click Restart to confirm. This immediately shuts down and reboots your Mac. Wait for your Mac to shut down.

steps.title: Press and hold C as the Mac restarts.
steps.content: Press and hold C as the Mac restarts. If you are using a USB drive instead of an installation disc, hold down ⌥ Option instead.

steps.title: Open Disk Utility.
steps.content: Open Disk Utility . It's located in the "Utilities" section of the Installation menu.

steps.title: Click on your Mac's hard drive.
steps.content: Click on your Mac's hard drive. It's in the upper-left of the window, under "Internal."

steps.title: Click the Erase tab.
steps.content: Click the Erase tab. It's at the top of the page.

steps.title: Name your disk.
steps.content: Name your disk. Type it in the "Name:" field.

steps.title: Click on the "Format:"
steps.content: Click on the "Format:" drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a format.
steps.content: Select a format. If you plan to reinstall OS X, select: Mac OS X Extended (Journaled) .

steps.title: Click on Erase.
steps.content: Click on Erase . It's in the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The wipe process will begin. The time to erase your disk will vary based on disk size and the amount of data that was stored on your hard drive.
